intro: Descurainia incisa, commonly known as narrowleaf tansy, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy surface. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters, blooming from June to August. Descurainia incisa is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
